column3:
Compiled successfully. Tests failed. Tried experimenting with `add_inputs`: 1. Transaction with 2 inputs selected manually and custom change address (A new receive address created and used as change): FALSE 
bumpfee fe60cda11767cd6c6c46a173a3ffa9cf3f71bc5f7af774ab641f6ede92fcd46a "{"add_inputs": false}"
Error: 
Unable to create transaction. Insu

@luke-jr I made the suggested change but am a little worried that it won't be clear to users what value to use if they don't want new inputs to be added.\n\n@prayank23 I will look into what causes a change address to behave differently and possibly propose something. I agree that the current change will make things worse if the behavior is inconsistent.
@prayank23 How did you create the change address in your second test case (i.e. the one that behaved wrongly)? Did you use `getrawchangeaddress` or something else?

@danben I used `getnewaddress` and `getrawchangeaddress`

Problem is with 2 things:

1. Using address returned in `getnewaddress` or something that doesn't belong to wallet
2. Using address which has a label even if it was created with `getrawchangeaddress`

<!--cf906140f33d8803c4a75a2196329ecb-->
üêô This pull request conflicts with the target branch and [needs rebase](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#rebasing-changes).

<sub>Want to unsubscribe from rebase notifications on this pull request? Just convert this pull request to a "draft".</sub>
Default should probably be "as needed", and let "true" (perhaps not now, but someday) be used to force additional inputs?
Wouldn't this be better as a plain bool?
@MarcoFalke That is what I had originally, but changed it to a string as per @luke-jr's suggestion from 2/23 (see above)
what is the use case to force adding inputs if none are needed?
I will defer to @luke-jr on that; I am not sure

I think you misunderstood me. I meant the documentation should be accurate, not that "as_needed" should be a value. Documenting it as "true" suggested that inputs would be added even if not needed.\n\nIf the user wants "as needed", they just would omit "add_inputs" (or specify it as null). But I suppose defaults should be possible to specify explicitly, too, so not sure how to handle that. :)
